contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = ''Ateuchosaurus'' | image = Ateuchosaurus chinensis.jpg | image_caption = ''[[Ateuchosaurus chinensis]]'' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Reptilia]] <small>([[paraphyletic]])</small> | unranked_ordo = [[Sauria]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] <small>([[paraphyletic]])</small> | infraordo = [[Scincomorpha]] | familia = [[Scincidae]] | subfamilia = see text | genus = '''''Ateuchosaurus''''' | genus_authority = | subdivision_ranks = [[Species]] | subdivision = 2, see text. }} '''''Ateuchosaurus''''' is a [[genus]] of [[skink]]s ([[family (biology)|family]] Scincidae) containing only 2 [[species]]. It is usually placed in the [[subfamily]] [[Scincinae]]. This group seems to be paraphyletic however, and the present genus is apparently not closely related to most or all of them. Rather, it seems to be slightly closer to ''[[Acontias]]''; it might either belong into the Acontinae or, as it seems to be quite distinct from ''Acontias'' too, into a not yet established novel and perhaps [[monotypic]] subfamily; more research is clearly required.(Austin & Arnold 2006) '''Species''' *''[[Ateuchosaurus chinensis]]'' *''[[Ateuchosaurus pellopleurus]]'' ==References== * {{aut|Austin, J.J. & Arnold, E.N.}} (2006): Using ancient and recent DNA to explore relationships of extinct and endangered ''Leiolopisma'' skinks (Reptilia: Scincidae) in the Mascarene islands. ''Molecular Phylogenetics and Evolution'' '''39'''(2): 503â€“511. <small>{{doi|10.1016/j.ympev.2005.12.011}}</small> (HTML abstract) {{skink-stub}} [[Category:Skinks]]
